result.execSummary:
The defendant Devin R. Mooney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
*4 days credit if revoked from Probation* 
22CM383 and 22CM252 dismissed and read in.

miscConds.notes: Amount to be determined within 60 days of sentencing.
No contact with M.K., M.R., or G.S. or any of their residences.

Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent, including anger management and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide a DNA sample.

timeConds.notes:
Defendant to complete 180 days in Jail with Huber, 150 days Stayed pending further order of the court. 
Remaining 30 days can be served by completing 240 hours of community service. Defendant chooses to complete community service.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devin R. Mooney

records.addlTxt:
10:16 AM cases 22CF670, 22CM150, 22CF532, 22CM118, 22CM252, 22CM260, 22CM383 called. Prosecuting attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Devin R. Mooney in court, in custody.  Attorney Melissa M. Petersen appeared by video for Devin R. Mooney. Attorney Karl Schmidt appears by video for Devin R Mooney. Attorney Amanda Mayer appears by video for victim G.S. 
Matter is resolved and the Defense recites the joint agreement. Defendant does not object to his attorney appearing via Zoom today. No victims appear in the courtroom. 
Attorney Amanda Mayer speaks on behalf of her client and asks that a PSI be ordered by the Court. 
Attorney Amanda Mayer requests a restitution hearing. Court states the restitution hearing can be set if needed. 
In felony files: Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 
In 22CF670: Defendant pleads No Contest to count 1 as charge in the Information. 
In 22CF532: Defendant pleads No Contest to count 1 as charge in the Information. 
In 22CM118: Defendant pleads Guilty to count 4 as charged in the Amended Complaint. 
In 22CM150: Defendant pleads Guilty to count 2 as charged in the Complaint. 
In 22CM260: Defendant pleads Guilty to count 1 as charged in the Complaint. 
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. 
Court accepts pleas and finds the defendant Guilty. Anything else is dismissed and read in. 
Defendant makes a statement before sentencing. 
10:45 AM A statutory victim enters the courtroom but does not wish to make a statement. 

As to count 1 in 22CF670 and count 1 in 22CF532: Court withholds sentencing and places defendant on probation for 4 years. 
As to all other counts to which the defendant was found guilty: Court withholds sentencing and places defendant on probation for 2 years. 
Conditions of both probation sentences include: 
Pay restitution in the amount of $3,566.52 (22CM118) plus 10% surcharge to be paid to M.K. ($3,457.16) and M.R. ($109.36). 
The State has 60 days to ask for any other restitution in the other files. 
No contact with M.K., M.R., or G.S. or any of their residences. 
Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent, including anger management and follow through with recommendations. 
Provide a DNA sample.  
Defendant to pay court costs including all applicable surcharges. 
In 22CF532 only:
Defendant to complete 180 days in Jail with Huber, 150 days Stayed pending further order of the court. 
Remaining 30 days can be served by completing 240 hours of community service. Defendant chooses to complete community service.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Cases called at 9:35 AM: 22CF532, 22CF670, 22CM118, 22CM150, 22CM252, 22CM260, 22CM383.
Prosecuting Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Devin R. Mooney in court, in custody with Attorney Melissa M. Petersen and Attorney Fran Rivard.
Counsel requests the felony cases be set for Preliminary Hearings.
Preliminary Hearing: 9/6/22 at 1:30 PM.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Cases called at 9:43 AM: 22CF532, 22CM118, 22CM150, 22CM252, 22CM260, 22CM383.
Prosecuting Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Devin R. Mooney in court with Attorney Melissa M. Petersen in court for Devin R. Mooney. 
Attorney Petersen requests an adjournment to work on a global offer.
Hearing scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 09:30 am.
The Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender Services. Despite best efforts, the State Public Defender Office has not yet secured representation for this Defendant.

ADDRESS INFO for Devin R. Mooney
Current: 4555 Tower Drive, Eau Claire, WI 54703 United States  (Effective: 05-13-2022)
Prior: 2405 E Princeton Ave Apt 3, Eau Claire, WI 54703

11:19am Cases called: 22CM383 & 22CF532. Supplemental Court Commissioner Wendy Sue Johnson for Br. 1 Intake, Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Devin R. Mooney appeared by video, in custody from the Eau Claire County Jail with Attorney Alicia Linzmeyer. Waives reading of the complaints. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived in 22CF532. State requests a $1500 cash bond and Defense requests a lower cash bond. Court orders a $200 cash bond to cover both cases. Cases scheduled to ride with other open cases.
Hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
No contact with G.S. or their residence.
Defendant not to drive any motor vehicles.
No use or possession of weapons, including knives.
(Covers 22CM383, 22CF532)
